Package me.moros.bending.util.methods

Class WorldMethods

java.lang.Object
me.moros.bending.util.methods.WorldMethods
public final class WorldMethods
extends java.lang.Object
Utility class with useful World related methods. Note: This is not thread-safe.

    • getNearbyBlocks

      public static @NonNull java.util.Collection<@NonNull org.bukkit.block.Block> getNearbyBlocks​(@NonNull org.bukkit.Location location, double radius)
      Returns:
      getNearbyBlocks(Location, double, Predicate, int) with predicate being always true and no block limit.

    • getNearbyBlocks

      public static @NonNull java.util.Collection<@NonNull org.bukkit.block.Block> getNearbyBlocks​(@NonNull org.bukkit.Location location, double radius, @NonNull java.util.function.Predicate<org.bukkit.block.Block> predicate)
      Returns:
      getNearbyBlocks(Location, double, Predicate, int) with the given predicate and no block limit.

    • getNearbyBlocks

      public static @NonNull java.util.Collection<@NonNull org.bukkit.block.Block> getNearbyBlocks​(@NonNull org.bukkit.Location location, double radius, @NonNull java.util.function.Predicate<org.bukkit.block.Block> predicate, int limit)
      Collects all blocks in a sphere that satisfy the given predicate.

      Note: Limit is only respected if positive. Otherwise all blocks that satisfy the given predicate are collected.

      Parameters:
      location - the center point
      radius - the radius of the sphere
      predicate - the predicate that needs to be satisfied for every block
      limit - the amount of blocks to collect
      Returns:
      all collected blocks

    • getNearbyBlocks

      public static @NonNull java.util.Collection<@NonNull org.bukkit.block.Block> getNearbyBlocks​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull AABB box)
      Returns:
      getNearbyBlocks(World, AABB, Predicate, int) with predicate being always true and no block limit.

    • getNearbyBlocks

      public static @NonNull java.util.Collection<@NonNull org.bukkit.block.Block> getNearbyBlocks​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull AABB box, @NonNull java.util.function.Predicate<org.bukkit.block.Block> predicate)
      Returns:
      getNearbyBlocks(World, AABB, Predicate, int) with the given predicate and no block limit.

    • getNearbyBlocks

      public static @NonNull java.util.Collection<@NonNull org.bukkit.block.Block> getNearbyBlocks​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull AABB box, @NonNull java.util.function.Predicate<org.bukkit.block.Block> predicate, int limit)
      Collects all blocks inside a bounding box that satisfy the given predicate.

      Note: Limit is only respected if positive. Otherwise all blocks that satisfy the given predicate are collected.

      Parameters:
      world - the world to check
      box - the bounding box to check
      predicate - the predicate that needs to be satisfied for every block
      limit - the amount of blocks to collect
      Returns:
      all collected blocks

    • getTarget

      public static @NonNull Vector3 getTarget​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull Ray ray)
      Returns:
      getTarget(World, Ray, Set) with an empty material set and ignoreLiquids = true

    • getTarget

      public static @NonNull Vector3 getTarget​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull Ray ray, boolean ignoreLiquids)
      Returns:
      getTarget(World, Ray, Set, boolean) with an empty material set

    • getTarget

      public static @NonNull Vector3 getTarget​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull Ray ray, @NonNull java.util.Set<@NonNull org.bukkit.Material> ignored)
      Returns:
      getTarget(World, Ray, Set, boolean) with ignoreLiquids = true

    • getTarget

      public static @NonNull Vector3 getTarget​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull Ray ray, @NonNull java.util.Set<@NonNull org.bukkit.Material> ignored, boolean ignoreLiquids)
      Gets the targeted location.

      Note: Ray.direction is a Vector3 and its length provides the range for the check.

      Parameters:
      world - the world to check in
      ray - the ray which holds the origin and direction
      ignored - an extra set of materials that will be ignored (transparent materials are already ignored)
      ignoreLiquids - whether liquids should be ignored for collisions
      Returns:
      the target location

    • blockCast

      public static java.util.Optional<org.bukkit.block.Block> blockCast​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull Ray ray, double range)
      See Also:
      blockCast(World, Ray, double, Set)

    • blockCast

      public static java.util.Optional<org.bukkit.block.Block> blockCast​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world, @NonNull Ray ray, double range, @NonNull java.util.Set<@NonNull org.bukkit.block.Block> ignore)
      Ray trace blocks using a BlockIterator.

      Note: Passable blocks except liquids are automatically ignored.

      Parameters:
      world - the world to check in
      ray - the ray which holds the origin and direction
      ignore - the set of blocks that will be ignored, passable block types are also ignored.
      Returns:
      Optional of the result block

      See Also:
      World.rayTraceBlocks(Location, Vector, double)

    • getTargetEntity

      public static java.util.Optional<org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity> getTargetEntity​(@NonNull User user, double range)
      Gets the provided user's targeted entity (predicate is used to ignore the user's entity).
      See Also:
      World.rayTraceEntities(Location, Vector, double, Predicate)

    • getTargetEntity

      public static java.util.Optional<org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity> getTargetEntity​(@NonNull User user, double range, int raySize)
      Gets the provided user's targeted entity (predicate is used to ignore the user's entity).
      See Also:
      World.rayTraceEntities(Location, Vector, double, double, Predicate)

    • isOnGround

      public static boolean isOnGround​(@NonNull org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Accurately checks if an entity is standing on ground using AABB. Note: For mobs you should prefer Entity.isOnGround(). This method is to be used for Players.
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity to check
      Returns:
      true if entity standing on ground, false otherwise

    • distanceAboveGround

      public static double distanceAboveGround​(@NonNull org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Calculates the distance between an entity and the ground using AABB. Uses a BlockIterator with the max world height as the range. By default it ignores all passable materials except liquids.
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity to check
      Returns:
      the distance in blocks between the entity and ground or the max world height.

    • isAgainstWall

      public static boolean isAgainstWall​(@NonNull User user, @NonNull java.util.function.Predicate<org.bukkit.block.Block> predicate)
      Check if a user is against a wall made of blocks matching the given predicate.

      Note: Passable blocks and barriers are ignored.

      Parameters:
      user - the user to check
      predicate - the type of blocks to accept
      Returns:
      whether the user is against a wall

    • isDay

      public static boolean isDay​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world)

    • isNight

      public static boolean isNight​(@NonNull org.bukkit.World world)
